g.text: Redox reactions at electrodes create potential difference
• Amount of charge battery can deliver
• Total energy stored: Wh = V × Ah
• Opposition to current flow inside battery

svg.text: • Examples: Alkaline (AA, AAA), Lithium coin cells
• Applications: Remote controls, watches, smoke alarms

g.text: Total Voltage = V₁ + V₂ + V₃ + V₄ = 6V
Current capacity remains same as single cell
Current capacity = I₁ + I₂ + I₃ (increased runtime)
Combines benefits of both configurations - higher voltage AND current capacity
Example: Electric vehicles, power tools, UPS systems
VTotal = (Cells per string) × VCell | ITotal = (Number of strings) × ICell

svg.text: Series: VTotal = V₁ + V₂ + ..., ITotal = ISingle
Parallel: VTotal = VSingle, ITotal = I₁ + I₂ + ...
V = Volts, A = Amperes, Ah = Ampere-hours
Cycle life = Number of charge cycles
